result.execSummary:
The defendant Andy B. Madl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Andy B. Madl is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Andy B. Madl was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: The defendant may not enter any bars/taverns or class B establishments.

The defendant must undergo an anger management assesstment and follow thru with all recommendations.

Must participate in restorative justice program (if victim is willing).

Defendant must write letter of apology to victim and must be done within 30 days and must be hand written.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must obtain/maintain absolute sobriety.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andy B. Madl

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Clerk did not prepare an amended JOC as the only change was who the restitution is to be paid to - faxed copy of new victim to DOC (per DOC)

Called at 11:48 AM. Andy Madl appears in person and without counsel. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Court asks defendant the status of his attorney (John Hogan). Madl states that he is no longer represented by Attorney Hogan - cannot afford this attorney anymore. Madl is willing to proceed without an attorney today. State - here on two different issues - State filed a motion and makes argument for motion - restitution should be made payable to Forest County Potawatomi Community instead of to victim (CD) - asks court to amend restitution owed to Forest County Potawatomi Community (FCPC) Health Insurance Department. The victim is in the courtroom today and has no objections to the JOC being amended to the restitution amount being paid to FCPC Health Insurance Department. COC office has already issued a check for $150.00 to the victim - State will have the victim sign this check over to FCPC Health Insurance Department and then amend JOC to reflect the victim is FCPC Health Insurance Department. State - other issue is in regards to the apology letter submitted by the defendant. State offers exhibits #1, #2 and #3 - apology letters written by defendant to the victim. Court reviews exhibits (11:56 AM). State - wants court to hear from victim in this matter regarding the letters. Court has victim make statement regarding the apology letters - not requesting that the court order the defendant to write another apology letter for stated reasons. Madl responds. Court not making exhibits part of the record for stated reasons. Court - amend JOC to reflect correct victim - not ordering the defendant to write another apology letter as victim is not requesting another one (for previoulsy stated reasons) but instructs him on the right thing to do - no further action will be taken - instructs defendant to make sure he follows rules of probation - gave documents back to State. Adjourned at 12:07 PM.
from defendant provided to court the day of sentencing

Defendant Andy B. Madl in court with attorney John J Hogan.  Jodi Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 8:51 am. Have a resolution. State move to dismiss counts 1 & 3 and count 2 amend to misd battery and asking for withheld sentence and place on 1 year probation with conditions of costs and restitution. Hogan agrees. Court amends count 2 and defendant pleads NC as amended. Court reads new charges/penalties to count 2. Court dismisses count 1 & 3. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds entering his plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently by entering his plea and waiving his right to JT, factual basis, adjudges guility. State has complied with victim notification. Victim is in courtroom and makes statement (8:58 am). State makes final arguement and is now going to revise recommendations, $2433.90 is restitution and includes surcharge - asking for anger management assesstment and follow thru, AODA and follow thru, costs, sober, not to enter into any bars/taverns, letter of apology to victim,  participate in restorative justice program. Hogan gives court statement from defendant to read and then would like to continue with argument prior to sentencing and asking no AODA condition and no restitution as all would go to insurance company, asking for fine and probation and only if appropriate to collect restitution. Madl w/holds statement and asks court to review his letter which Hogan submitted. Court sentences to the following:

Ct 2 - w/hold and place on probation for 1 year - costs - anger management assesstment and follow aftercare - write letter of apology to victim (must be done w/in 30 days and must be hand written) - participate in restorative justice program (if victim is willing) - absolute sobriety - no entry into bars/taverns or class b establishments  - AODA and follow thru - restitution $2433.90 (includes victim surcharge) - DNA surcharge $200 - apply bond. 

Appeal rights given.
BM - sub service done on mother KM
and Certificate of Appearance - Deputy Seriff JMC
Jury trial on September 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Called at 1:34 PM. Andy Madl appears in person and with counsel Jennifer Stuber who appears specially for John Hogan. State appears by JBC. Stuber - not resolved - received discovery last weekend. Court recuses himself for stated reasons - will set with another Judge. Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on July 16, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 3:11 PM. Andy Madl appears in person and with counsel John Hogan. State appears by Charles Simono. State calls Officer Eric Bath. Officer Bath sworn in at 3:12 PM. Direct exam by State. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant. Cross exam by Hogan at 3:20 PM. State objects - argumentative - overruled (3:23 PM). State objects - plausability - overruled (3:26 PM). Bath excused at 3:28 PM. State calls Carole Daniels. Daniels sworn in at 3:28 PM. Direct exam by State. Hogan objects - question not asked - State asks question (3:32 PM). Hogan objects - leading - overruled (3:33 PM). Cross exam by Hogan at 3:35 PM. State objects - asked and answered - overruled (3:36 PM). State objects - irrelevant - overruled (3:38 PM). State objects - relevance - sustained (3:39 PM). State objects - relevance and speculation - sustained (3:39 PM). Daniels excused at 3:39 PM. No argument by State. Hogan does not feel that probable cause has been met, asks for dismissal of felony charges. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Hogan has Information, waives reading, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for FPT on  7/16/14 at 1:15 PM. State asks for modify conditions of bond for no consumption of alcohol. Hogan objects. Court - bond - adds condition of no consumption of alcohol to bond.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on May 28, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:05 AM. Andy Madl appears in person and with Attorney John Hogan. State appears by JBC. Hogan has complaint, enters NG pleas to all misd counts, requests PH but will waive time limits. Court accepts pleas on misd counts, considers time limits waived, set for PH on 5/28/14 at 3:00 PM. Court sets bond at $150.00 cash, no contact with Carole Daniels.
